how I ot event solves this problem then we're going to talk about how it really

wind turbine here on stage but we'll kind of show you on the browser so what
are operational events in this context there are several things which we consider operational events for the
purpose of IOT events one is equipment malfunction so that could be like a motor being stock commercial
refrigerator door not opening something like that it could be any sign of poor quality so a sign that quality is not
where you need it to be it could be sign of wear and tear on equipment requiring pre-emptive
maintenance or a park change like changing a dirty filter or a battery which is depleting in charge or
something like that it is also the state of processes so this is not just for equipment it also could be applied to
processes so it's also helps to determine the state of processes as determined with a
combination of discrete inputs and ml models and we'll talk about that a little later on how you can use ml for
probabilistic state determination so what problems are customers trying to
solve and we've kind of put that into two categories here the first category is what we're calling predict prevent
and diagnose and here we're going to talk about three things the first is predictive maintenance which usually
starts with simple rule-based alerts until sufficient data is collected and then ml models can be applied to do more
predictive type detect complex behavior patterns and anomalies and stuff like
that the second is predictive quality so using near real-time anomaly detection
and predictive analytics we can detect quality issues at their source so if we
could detect intermittent failures in an airplane or an assembly line of some kind or even like a soda dispensing
machine in a restaurant we can send a technician with the right parts to fix that problem before it really becomes a
problem and it breaks down and that saves valuable time and the last one is accurate failure diagnosis and this is
all about reducing false alarms so there are a lot of detection systems out there today and they're mostly just get turned
off or the alerts get ignored because of the high rate of false alarms so if we can actually reduce the false alarms
then these alerts can get the attention they need so that's kind of another use case of this the second category is
improving efficiency so here we talk about improving efficiency of equipment processes products staff anything right
in an industrial setting or a manufacturing setting or a commercial building or a service industry even
small improvements can save millions of dollars in savings and uncovering early
causes of disruption can significantly reduce planned downtime and that increases throughput so the cost of
having an assembly line down for a single minute or an airplane sitting on the tarmac or in the case of that soda
dispensing machine not working and people are being able to pour drinks even those small improvements can
translate into big savings at scale and that's kind of what this service is there to solve so where where
are we today industrial enterprises are adopting IOT at a fast rate to monitor operations increase the quality of
plants invert plant safety and reliability and then even consumer electronic OMS are adopting IOT at a
fast rate to offer new consumer experiences and improve the efficiency of their equipment and processes and at
scale these IOT deployments consists of hundreds of thousands of sensors depending on what you're dealing with
and lots of management applications and for these customers it is hard to detect
a complex event such as when the equipment variability will reduce the
quality of output so what today customers are doing is they're first making homegrown applications to collect

so the question we're posing is how can your business benefit from detecting

AWS IOT events comes into play so AWS IOT events is a new cloud service that
continuously monitors data from equipment and applications for changes and operations and triggers appropriate

a topper ations faster so if you look at the picture on the screens their inputs on the left they get routed into what we

where increasing US port efficiency by even 0.5% results in additional 263
million dollars a day in Freight value so that's a lot of money that can be saved by just improving how we automate
our ports so how does the service work AWS IOT events takes inputs from
multiple sources it takes device data from IOT core it takes results of analytics from AWS IOT
analytics and it takes input data from a Greengrass device running on the edge it can also take any external input by a
put API and that's that's really how you route anything which is coming from
outside AWS into IOT events your inputs are not necessarily coming from the AWS
services these inputs then get routed to an event detector the event detector is
a custom author JSON that models a piece of equipment or a process as being in
one of several states and it detects one or more types of events using the multiple signals that are going into the
detector and then you could play logic boolean logic or any other kinds of mathematical functions to that when the
detector detects an event it triggers actions and that action may result in a change of state as well what are the different types of actions
possible so there's an action library and we trigger actions as sue within seconds common actions are sending a
message why AWS SNS triggering a function in AWS lambda which obviously
can trigger external applications as well you can write a record to dynamodb or you could send a message to a device

at GA iot events truly brings a lot of our recently launched services in IOT

sending messages from devices directly to IOT events and IOT events can also

sage maker to provide ml in event detection and probabilistic state
determination it also integrates with Jupiter notebooks so you can actually schedule your custom analytics to run

that and it will spin off a detector for that device so as devices get sold they
come online people connect them these detectors just automatically keep spinning up and that's a huge benefit
